glosses: With the intention to make someone jealous or upset someone.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish نسبت (nisbet, nispet, “a relationship, relation, ratio, proportion, spite, spiteful or defiant act”), from Arabic نِسْبَة (nisba, “relationship, affiliation, connection, relation”), verbal noun of نَسَبَ (nasaba). Cognates with Azerbaijani nisbət, Bashkir нисбәт (nisbət), Uzbek nisbat.
